entries.title: Starbucks CEO Howard Schultz tells corporate workers to return to the office 3 days a week
entries.description: Starbucks corporate employees will be returning to the office at least three days by the end of the month.

entries.title: Burning Man sues Biden administration over geothermal project
entries.description: The suit, filed in Nevada federal court on Monday, alleged that the BLM violated the National Environmental Policy Act and other laws in 2022.

entries.title: Why the Winklevoss brothers are in a $900 million crypto faceoff with Barry Silbert
entries.description: Digital Currency Group's Barry Silbert and Cameron Winklevoss have been engaged in a public war of words over the fate of $900 million.

entries.title: Apple reportedly considering touchscreen Mac laptop for 2025
entries.description: The move, if it were to happen, would mark a significant reversal for Apple, which has said for years that touchscreen laptops are ergonomically inferior.

entries.title: Disney to make Nike's Mark Parker chairman as it opposes Nelson Peltz's push to join board
entries.description: The Walt Disney Company has named Mark Parker, the executive chairman of Nike, its next chairman of the board.

entries.title: Inflation is expected to have declined in December, but it may not be enough to stop the Fed
entries.description: The pace of consumer inflation is expected to have fallen in December due to lower energy prices, but the annual rate was still likely uncomfortably high.

entries.title: Alphabet to cut staff of health sciences unit Verily by 15%
entries.description: It's the first known layoff to hit the Google parent company in the current tech downturn.

entries.title: The creator of tech's big layoff tracker says more cuts are on the way—here's when it could slow
entries.description: How job-seekers can check the stability of a prospective employer.

entries.title: Ubisoft cancels three games and slashes targets, citing 'worsening macroeconomic conditions'
entries.description: Ubisoft said it expects its 2022 net bookings to fall 10%, after an earlier forecast called for an increase of 10%.

entries.title: Biden's plea to lawmakers in rare op-ed: Unite to hold tech accountable
entries.description: In a WSJ op-ed, Biden made one of the most pointed calls yet for Congress to take action on topics including digital privacy, competition and online safety.

entries.title: Flexport to lay off 20% of its global workforce
entries.description: Flexport, the supply chain software startup, is laying off 20% of its workforce, roughly 640 employees, as trade volumes weaken in a global economic downturn.

entries.title: Omicron XBB.1.5 does not have mutations known to make people sicker, WHO says
entries.description: The WHO said omicron XBB.1.5 does not have any mutations known to make people sicker, but added that it needs more data to draw conclusions about its severity.

entries.title: Paul Tudor Jones, hedge fund billionaire, wants to do away with 'ESG'
entries.description: Hedge fund billionaire Paul Tudor Jones is a major backer of ESG efforts, but says the real focus should be on workers, not the environment.

entries.title: For the first time in over a decade, Apple and Meta aren't on Glassdoor's 100 Best Places to Work list
entries.description: A Glassdoor economist explains why Apple and Meta aren't on their 2023 Best Places to Work list for the first time in over a decade.

entries.title: The 10 best U.S. places to work in 2023, according to Glassdoor
entries.description: These companies offer ample opportunities for career advancement, robust health care benefits and remote or hybrid work opportunities, among other benefits.

entries.title: Biden administration extends Covid public health emergency as highly infectious omicron XBB.1.5 spreads
entries.description: The public health emergency extension occurs amid concern that the nation may face another wave of hospitalizations from the disease this winter.

entries.title: Apple Maps is getting a big update. Here's what it looks like
entries.description: The features announced on Wednesday are free and Apple isn't selling ad units in Maps.

entries.title: FTX has recovered $5 billion worth of 'liquid' assets, lawyers say
entries.description: FTX lawyers said they had recovered $5 billion of assets, including cash and crypto, bringing customers closer to recovering from the exchange's collapse.

entries.title: Crypto exchange Binance plans 15-30% hiring spree in 2023 even as rivals slash jobs
entries.description: Crypto exchange Binance plans to increase the number of staff by between 15% and 30%, CEO Changpeng Zhao said.

entries.title: Inflation crisis poses greatest near-term global threat, Davos survey warns
entries.description: Energy supply, food scarcity and inflation concerns have roared back in 2023, according to an annual WEF report.

entries.title: FAA orders airlines to pause departures after system outage
entries.description: U.S. flights were delayed after the Federal Aviation Administration suffered an outage of the system that sends messages to pilots.

entries.title: Major central bankers dispute role in tackling climate change as they battle inflation
entries.description: Divisions are forming among the world's most influential central banks over their role in tackling climate change, as policymakers focus on reining in inflation.

entries.title: Currency experts are turning bullish on the euro as Europe looks to hold off a recession
entries.description: As markets head into a year of uncertainty against a backdrop of shifting economic data and monetary policy, analysts are turning positive on the outlook for the euro.

entries.title: Prince Harry memoir breaks UK sales records and tops Amazon bestseller lists
entries.description: Prince Harry's memoir "Spare" became the fastest selling non-fiction book ever in the U.K. on its release day, its publisher said Tuesday.

entries.title: The West’s oil war against Russia is starting to take its toll — sparking calls for tougher measures
entries.description: Russia's revenues from fossil fuel exports collapsed in December, according to a new report, hampering Moscow's ability to finance the war in Ukraine.

entries.title: Global spending on mobile games falls 5% as high inflation causes market to cool
entries.description: Mobile game spending fell 5% last year, to $110 billion, according to Data.ai. Nevertheless, downloads rose 8% to a record 90 billion.

entries.title: Sweden is facing its ‘day of reckoning’ as house prices plummet
entries.description: This downturn is not surprising given the "dysfunctional" nature of the market, according to Stefan Ingves, the outgoing governor of Sweden's central bank, the Riksbank.

entries.title: World Bank makes big cut to its 2023 growth outlook, says globe is 'perilously close' to recession
entries.description: The World Bank slashed its global growth forecasts from projections it made in mid-2022 on the back of what it sees as broadly worsening economic conditions.

entries.title: South Korea shares eye-opening Covid statistics to defend its new rules for travelers from China
entries.description: South Korea hit back at claims its Covid rules for Chinese travelers are "discriminatory," saying more than half of its imported cases are coming from China.

entries.title: Winter of 'disconnect': Morgan Stanley's Mike Wilson braces for more than 20% stock drop
entries.description: Morgan Stanley chief investment officer Mike Wilson warns investors are dangerously unprepared for a weak earnings season.

entries.title: Biden classified documents: White House won't say why it didn't disclose earlier that records were found
entries.description: A lawer for President Joe Biden only revealed that classified documents were found in a private office linked to him two months after the midterm elections.
